When the souls are released, they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.
What’s scarier than being bombarded with skulls from a distance? Why, if they are on fire and screaming in anguish of course!
Each serpentine steed is spurred to acts of great brutality in the name of the king.
Tethered to their mounts by a sharp hook, the other mummified hand wields a barbed staff to carve through mortal flesh.
Channelling her ancient, ageless fury, the Asp-Goddess’ chosen riders bite with her deadly venom.
Skeletal steeds instinctively obey the will of their riders, displaying the same supernatural discipline.
Emerging from the desert dust clouds, these horsemen come charging out of the storm, and death rides with them.
Amidst a churning cloud of heaved-up sand, these Undead warriors charge their foes with supernatural determination.
These riders never tire and can chase foes down over countless leagues, until their dying moment.
Nagash must rise, or our realms of silence will fall.
Khalida marches to war with all the poise she had in life, yet more brutal and merciless than ever.
The Liche Lord, ancient beyond memory, wanders the deserts in search of powerful artefacts to restore his beloved kingdom to its former glory.
The savage desert itself obeys the one who summons the dunes and the dead to fight for him.
The keeper of the arcane lore casts terrible curses, summoning vengeful desert spirits to feast upon their souls.
All the Necrotects see now is purity besmirched. With a whipcrack they strive once more for perfection.
Settra ruled over the most magnificent realm ever known; now he will see it restored.
The Tomb Kings know nothing but rage and the desire to reclaim their lost kingdoms.
Entombed alongside their mighty sovereign, Nehekhara's deathless princes are reawakened to command the Undead legions.
The Warriors of Nehekhara remember only their duty to their king, and pursue his enemies with ruthless purpose.
The faceless God of the Underworld guides dead souls to the other life – some at the price of their service in battle.
These desiccated husks remember how to shoot; a hail of endless death to thin the foe's numbers.
Existing only to serve, the Hawk-God’s blessed archers deliver his swift justice – a rain of death from above – long after their own lives have ended.
Spears extend, like gnarled and sharpened bones, held firmly in place by their deathly-grip.
Elite amongst their skeletal peers, these spear-armed warriors are as bloodthirsty as their infamous royal patron.
The Undead devotees of the Tomb Kings are risen again, unswervingly loyal to their liege.
These guards' loyalty in life was rewarded; now they are expected to show it once more.
Their great weapons are wielded as expertly as they did in life, slaying for Lord and glory!
Like the flesh-eating, skull-faced beetle, whose name they bear, this dual-wielding, elite Tomb Guard bring a new level of terror to the battlefield.
The Carrion of the Desert, whose mighty outstretched wings darken the sun on the day of slaughter.
The keen eyes of Djaf’s Carrion can spot a meal - or an artillery target - over great distances.
Death's true face radiates sinister magic; the cruel laughter of ancient gods echoes within its shadow.
The living are scythed down as these nightmarish beasts glide and bound amongst their helpless, terrified prey.
The fury of the gods made stone, these chosen Sphinxes augment their brutal scythe-attack with magic and fire.
These sentinels mark the borders of the Tomb Kings' realm, submerged in the sand, waiting to strike at the unsuspecting.
Lying in wait, biding their time. The desert sees all. Nothing escapes.
They can burrow for leagues when summoned, bursting into battle with a blast of sand and snapping limbs.
With a swish of their lethal, poisoned tails, the foe is rendered paralysed and helpless, to be consumed by ravening jaws.
The physical embodiment of the everlasting gods; curse ye all men who look upon their divine forms!
Tremble at their imposing sight, run in vain from their mighty arrows.
Bearing the faces of Nehekhara’s illustrious pantheon, these Ushabti use spear-sized arrows – and the fear of the gods – to strike at the unfortunate foe.
A monolithic force of destruction on the battlefield - each tremendous footstep crushing many foolish warriors underfoot.
An unearthly mixture of wood, metal and bone to savage the foe in rending, powerful strikes.
From the chariot's elevated platform, archers are offered unparalleled opportunities to fire on the enemy.
Tretch's formidable repertoire of underhanded skills, combined with his famously good luck, has led to a number of legendary deeds!
Hollow-eyed murderers, the Doomfire Warlocks must loosen the grip of Slaanesh with the blood of others.
With riders as deadly as their mounts, the Knights of the Ebon Claw are a force to be reckoned with.
The Raven Heralds appear from nowhere, leaving piles of corpses in their wake.
Slaanesh has an insatiable appetite for Elven souls, and the Harvesters are only too happy to oblige!
Greatest of all the Brides of Khaine, the many ways of murder are Hellebron's to command.
The control of beasts is usually the domain of Clar Karond, but there are Sorceresses who can wield the Wind of Ghur as well as any lash.
Death stalks all that come to Ghrond, and those who wield the power of Shyish are more adept than most in murder's arcane arts.
A Supreme Sorceress excels at not just Dark Magic, but also the ability to control and summon beasts - a mistress of Ghur.
Is there any greater dealer of death than a Sorceress at the height of her powers? Perhaps… but none will take as great a joy in unleashing it.
Death stalks all that come to Ghrond, and those who wield the power of Shyish are more adept than most in murder's arcane arts.
The hot, searing Red Wind blows down from the north to inflame passions and, if not used carefully, the spellcasters themselves.
Supreme Sorceresses wield powerful magic that lesser mortals can only dream of.
Like their mistress, the Blades of the Blood Queen glory in bloodshed.
The Sisters of Slaughter are creatures of instinct, impossible to predict and unfathomably deadly.
The sisters specialise in the three D's: doom, death and destruction.
A bolt in the eye is a terrible way to die, and the calling card of the Bolt-fiends.
Disciplined and merciless, it is a pleasure to watch the Hellebronai work.
The Chill of Sontar is a ruthless killing machine.
These incarnations of Khaine strike fear in to all those who stand before them.
A loathsome beast of uncharted depths possessing colossal strength and insatiable hunger.
Called forth by the Horn of the Ancestors, ready to once again slay the foes of the Karaz Ankor.
The mighty deeds of the Fireborn are spoken of in hushed tones by all the princes of Caledor.
The Heralds are renowned for their ability to read the ebb and flow of battle.
Alarielle the Radiant, High Priestess of Isha and Everqueen of Ulthuan.
Alith Anar is the Shadow King, a revenant who seeks the grisly death of every Dark Elf in retribution for Malekith’s sins.
At all times these beautiful warriors accompany the Everqueen, as her advisors and protectors.
High Elves have been studying the night skies long before the astromancers of the Empire, and so can freely manipulate the Wind of Azyr.
The Mages of Saphery excel at all forms of magic; the spells of shadows and illusion are no exception.
Only the purest of heart may serve the Everqueen.
These silent sentinels guard the Shrine of Asuryan.
Defenders of Cothique and chosen by the Lord of the Deeps himself.
The Shadow Warriors of Nagarythe are grim soldiers who fight for revenge alone.
With hearts to match that of Charandis himself, the Puremane Company are fearless.
Guardians of the sacred places of Avelorn, these peerless archers are incorruptible.
The Elves of the Grey have battled ceaselessly for generations, and will continue that tradition for generations to come.
The sight of the Storm Riders' banners strikes fear in to the hearts of even the most merciless Druchii.
Great warriors and doomseekers who have unsuccessfully found death thus far... even against Giants.
The Shadow King’s right-hand Elf is as committed to the Druchii’s destruction as his murderous monarch.
The Shadow King’s right-hand Elf is just as committed to the Druchii’s destruction as his murderous monarch.
As well as commanding bands of Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers form an elite retinue of Nagarythe’s finest to accompany Alith Anar into battle.
Broadside cannons for sinking mortal ships are devastating when used in the field, pulverising living flesh and solid walls.
This Hellhammer Cannon has been refined by the Pirate King himself to be one of the most feared artillery pieces in existence.
The heinous combination of a Fell Bat and a gun-wielding zombie makes for a hideous, flying horror.
Beware the Deck Droppers’ black powder bombs released indiscriminately – if somewhat inaccurately – from above!
Until their targets lie dead and bullet-riddled, there is no rest for the Salt Lord’s wicked assailants of the skies.
Chastised in life due to their recklessness, these Knights exist past their deaths in an eternal state of ghostly damnation.
These eminent horsemen were previously entrusted to defend Bretonnian lands to their dying breath – an event that has long past.
Once defined by their ability to face trials and overcome hardships, now their only quest is to attend to the vengeful Madame-Captain.
The daughter of Manann himself is the most feared captain in Sartosa, as merciless as an ocean tempest.
The Siren of the Storm’s tortured soul vengefully roams the world’s seas, singing her paralysing songs of death.
The hiss of the Vampire Admiral’s orders spurs an Undead crew to enact their master’s sinister will.
Wielding her cursed cutlass, this swashbuckling Vampire cripples and kills all who dare oppose her.
These former marksmen and artillerymen are as obsessed with gunpowder in death as they were in life.
Served by the reanimated corpses of shipwrecked unfortunates, the Pirate King is a plague upon the world’s seas.
Malice personified, a Haunter never knows relief from its manic, all-consuming hunger.
With power syphoned from the ocean’s Winds, the Dreadfleet commander seeks to drown the mortal world in a tide of death.
Even the very pinnacles of Bretonnian chivalry and brilliance are not immune to being conjured up as ethereal slaves.
Zombie pirate crews love dragging a big gun into a fight, no matter how unwieldy it might be!
Puppets of Vangheist’s cadaverous warship, driven by Dark Magic to inflict horror and damage in debilitating abundance.
The Blood Knights of the sea are elite, armour-clad sentries to the dreaded seafaring creatures of the night.
The only thing scarier than a Depth Guard is one with a weapon that gives it an eight-foot reach.
Like the Bloody Reaver upon which they serve, the Deck Guard are forged with the powerful magic of Noctilus himself.
Their howls turn even the bravest sailors stark white, spearing their souls like a lance through the heart.
These Undead mariners are competent crewmen and relentless fighters, making them ideal pirates.
The Deckhands’ polearms are rusty extensions of the decomposing arms that brandish them.
These reanimated Norscans are Unliving proof that Manann’s will can be manifested from death as well as life.
The random discharge of noisy, indiscriminate firepower gives the Gunnery Mob a small spark of satisfaction enjoyed in life.
Undead minions have no fear of blowing themselves up, making them ideal gunpowder-keg-launchers!
Where marksmanship might be lacking, a more powerful firearm will usually suffice.
Rifles afford better accuracy, which can be advantageous for the clumsy hands of the rotting Undead.
The Pirate King’s personal band of zombie gunmen are a toxic mixture of black powder and noxious imbuements.
Walking, rotting Ogre flesh fused with ship debris and sea monsters makes for truly twisted abominations.
Swollen with volatile, noxious gases, their liquefying tissues strain dangerously under rotten and tattered skin.
Terrifyingly ravenous mockeries of life, bound into monstrous groups with arcane spells.
“The emptinessss… the hunger… if only I could be warm again… it’s all I think of between dark, waking dreamsss.”
A colossal walking frame of galleon-torn timber, iron, and man-flesh, relentlessly driven by a vortex of deathly energy.
The terror of Bogenhafen leaves nothing living in its wake, driven by a dark appetite for murder and destruction.
A gargantuan, annihilative force of nature, unnaturally brought back from death to wreak yet more death.
Scuttling across the battlefield, these killer arthropods want nothing less than to dismember and decapitate anything that comes near.
A stampede of crab-like monsters is all the scarier when accompanied by the hisses and cracks of gunpowder weapons.
Detestable Undead dragoons of the sea, risen to expedite vengeance in the form of giant pincers and rusty bullets.
These rabid beasts are the ideal raiding companions, more vicious in death than they ever were in life.
A piercing scream, a swooping shadow upon the water – a dead body drained of blood.
You'll never find a less trustworthy rabble, but for the right price they'll fight to the death... and beyond.
The doom-bringing Krakenlord of Karond Kar fights as naturally as he reads the oceanic temper.
Fallen Imperial knights, risen again to serve their ancient Bloodline for eternity.
Descended from Neferata, thought to be the very first Vampire, Lahmians are alluring, seductive, and deadly in equal measure.
Grotesque and withered, Necrarchs may be weaker in combat, but their magical prowess is second to none.
Large and heavily-set, Ushoran's descendants are the animalistic blunt instruments of the Vampire race.
Such weapons require little more skill than the ability to point and shoot - even the smallfolk can be trusted with their use.
Fortunately, the smallfolk can be fielded in such numbers that the handgun's lack of accuracy and tendency to explode does little to blunt their attack.
Though their origins are shrouded in mystery, Vlad and his descendants now swarm across the world, bringing their gift of death to all!
The Cold Ones upon which they ride instinctively recognise the same cold-blooded cunning within the hearts of these consummate warriors.
Each rider fights with aggressive skill, but they pale in comparison to the viciousness of their mounts!
The most experienced riders atop some of the least controllable beasts in existence? Prepare to meet your death!
The keenest eyes, the sharpest reflexes, the coldest of hearts.
Marked for greatness amidst an already-blessed spawning, these Skink Chiefs are the leaders of their red-crested legions.
The Prophet seeks to deliver Lustria from its beleaguerment by way of the only tribute acceptable to Sotek – prodigious sacrifice!
The foremost airborne defender of the temple-cities is peerless in his vigilance and daring, timing aerial assaults to deadly perfection.
Ignominious defeat at perfidious Skaven hands has only strengthened the already-steely resolve of Chaqua's surviving Saurus.
These Skinks are differentiated by their impressive red crests, but are also stronger and cleverer than their lesser cousins.
Having survived the Skaven onslaught that destroyed their home, now they follow the Serpent-God, to the very End Times if necessary.
Only the strongest spawnings, in both mind and body, are fit to guard the Old Ones' Star Chambers.
The eldest of the fabled First Generation and the original Relic Priest, Kroak labours tirelessly to further the Great Plan.
Moving just as swiftly on land as in the water, these giant, predatory reptiles spit corrosive venom before closing in for the kill.
This great beast has both the temperament and strength to bear the Engines of the Gods to battle and beyond.
Unfeasably large, even for an Ancient Stegadon, fear and dread accompanies this enormous specimen's ground-shaking stomp.
This 'Living Bastion' has few predators save the terrain it must traverse, making it the ideal conveyor for the Ark of Sotek itself.
Almost too much lizard for their Skink handlers to handle, there's almost no holding these natural predators back!
This shadowy tide of poisonous, scaly reptiles rarely tire and are always hungry. Always.
You see… only your imminent death, haha, yes-yes!
If you're facing Ikit's cannon crew, chances are you're already dead!
Doooooooooooooooom! Muwahahahaha, yes-yes!
The notorious tinker-rat known as Ikit Claw focuses his diabolical pursuits on building the most heinous killing-contraptions possible.
Cunning overseers, whose job it is to manage and well, steal any credit that may be due an inventive Warlock Engineer.
These Clanrats' sport nasty, improvised tailblades that are all the more vicious for their homemade ingenuity.
Good luck getting close enough to these foul, pestilential creatures to kill them without getting infected!
The very latest technology Clan Skryre have to offer requires a special breed of suicidal nutters to operate it effectively.
Keep your mouth shut and your head down if you want to live.
In a society as corrupt and perfidious as this, the law-makers must be protected from those over whom they rule.
These ludicrously long-barrelled guns require two Skaven to operate effectively, though safety be damned!
They may be literally falling apart at the seams, but this rag-tag band share a dead-eyed accuracy that's hard to beat.
These crack Jezzail operators are the most accurate among their already-deadly kind; best keep your head down if you value your eyesight!
It's not quite as bad as it sounds… In fact, it's far, far worse. Prepare to die.
This particular spikey ball of cyclic death is the very bane of the Dwarfen race, whose little legs cannot carry themselves away fast enough!
Pity the unfortunate facing such a device - they will need every ounce of wit and fighting ability to prevail against it.
The dread Wheelz crush those caught 'neath their spikey-tracked engines of death!
…and Hell, quite literally, followed with it.
Do not be deceived, for the rampant lion's bite is immeasurably worse than its fearsome roar.
The ability to shoot several arrows per minute means that Archers are still far more efficient than more technically-advanced skirmish troops.
A physician by choice but a Witch Hunter by bloodline, Doctor van Hal both preserves natural life and destroys unnatural evil.
Jorek Grimm is a master inventor unlike any other of his kin – a bold, radical risk-taker.
A solemn and sorrowful Waystalker, Kalara possesses a demeanour that belies her furious lethality.
No mere soldier of fortune, Rodrik’s resilience and swordsmanship make him a valuable asset in any theatre of war.
Merchant barges laden with valuable trade goods must be protected from anything lurking close to, and swimming beneath, the waterways.
One can rely on the Deathjacks to silently track the foe to their location... but also snaffle the baggage train and the last of the mead!
The fire will always burn, just as the courage of this elite band of men will never be extinguished.
The God of the Dead's chosen Knights provide a steady supply of settlers to populate His ethereal realm.
Fortunately, Ostland's dank, forest-clothed terrain produces elite warriors able to withstand the continual Ruinous incursions threatening the province.
Among the Empire's most-storied regiments, the Carroburg Greatswords have earned their bloody reputation by slaying all comers in defence of their home city.
Elite marines trained by the Imperial Navy to fight both above deck, battered by adverse weather and raked by missile fire, and below, where melee skill is key.
A veteran patroller and fearless warrior who knows the Drakwald – and the tactics of irregular warfare – inside out, Durz Gunderman leads from the very front.
Veterans of many scouting parties, they are the most experienced among the Empire's elite Huntsmen, and therefore the best candidates to lead.
The ultimate irregular warriors, Huntsmen appear suddenly, throwing the enemy into disarray before melting away again just as swiftly.
The white wolf is a fitting symbol for Ulric, God of Battle and patron deity of these versatile infantrymen of Middenheim.
Only the most-disciplined and highly-trained are suitable for service with Solland's elite guard regiment.
The Huntsmarshal has risen from lowly commoner to become the most successful slayer of monsters within Imperial borders.
An expert in putting down the living and the dead, Bennec Sootson's guns always fire sure and true.
The challenging topography of the borderlands breeds a special kind of horseman.
The progeny of the great and the good of Imperial society, steeled and ready for the long fight.
Just like the Emperor's boundless anger at those who would threaten his lands, this lurching mechanical beast steamrollers the opposition.
Funded by the Church, Ulric's 'sons' are schooled against Beastmen, ensuring they always fight with zeal and vigour – for the alternative is to be torn apart whilst still living!
Although gradually becoming obsolete due to considerable advances in technology, there's still something inherently reliable about a horse-drawn chariot literally brimming with death.
Mounting a deadly mortar atop that bulwark of the battlefield, the War Wagon, can only improve your chances of victory.
The Huntsmarshal's hand-picked band of trackers have fought all over the world by his side – and will even follow him into the Realm of Souls if called to do so!
A reverberation of the past maybe, but one which brings resounding terror and screaming death, right now, to those unlucky enough to face them.
This colossal predator is made all the more lethal by the team of blowpipe-wielding Skinks it carries atop its massive body.
The Old Ones' enemies shall be torn to ribbons by this mighty predator and his Skink companions.
The Great White Lizard is renowned for the stoicism he displays whilst simultaneously savaging his enemies in battle.
The oldest and wisest are their kind's natural leaders on the field of battle.
Is he the eldest of the Kroxigor Ancients or the murderous spirit of the deepest jungle made flesh? You won't have long to decide!
Just one Razordon is a deadly proposition; if there's a pack of them you should probably run away... now!
Hailing from deep within the Amaxon Basin, these reptiles instinctively hunt in a co-ordinated fashion, creating a savage synergy.
These enormous, revered lizards are almost silent despite their size – causing great surprise among the foe, briefly, before they are ripped to shreds.
The City of Reawakening spawns the most dedicated warriors, eager to slaughter the beligerent, usurping younger races.
The humble shepherdess who once saved Bretonnia is a champion of the peasantry, bechosen of the Lady, and an inspirational leader of Knights.
Stripped of their beauteous forms by the goddess Atharti, Medusae know nothing but pain, torment, regret and anguish.
Once one of the most beautiful Sorceresses of Ghrond, the Siren’s malicious wails channel her anguish into blasts of pure, unbridled hatred.
To the Druchii, the scent of suffering is akin to the finest perfume, and no sound more despairing than the twisted echo of a shrine-bound Medusa.
With a crack of his whip, the Beastmaster torments his feral puppets, bringing even the unruliest critters to heel.
Hag Graef’s greatest tyrant is also its most blighted soul, whose fate is inexorably intertwined with the Drinker of Worlds.
Masters are Dreadlords in the making. They are yet to prove themselves in command of their own raiding party, but are eager to show their abilities and deadly ambition.
The flying manifestations of Khaine himself swoop down from above, feasting on their prey with fiery vengeance.
Swift and untouchable to their foes, Scourgerunners can unleash a bombardment of powerful harpoons that can pierce even the toughest of hides.
Poison-tipped harpoons and barbed nets enable these dread charioteers to break and enslave their prey in servitude to the Beastlord Rakarth.
Eshin’s supreme operative is a potent instrument of murder and sabotage, unseen until the fleeting moment of his victim's death.
Mysterious techniques and tricks from the distant east enable the Eshin Sorcerer to weave fiendish spells of pain and misdirection.
Only after surviving the Nightlord’s toughest trials can an Eshin warrior consider himself a master in the methodologies of murder and sabotage.
Though Lord Visktrin has been dead for centuries, his elite unit still worship him, persisting in murderous duties in their fallen leader’s name.
Swift of foot and hidden from sight, the Triads’ killing techniques are as emphatic in combat as the rumours suggest.
The teachings of Iksha Fastclaw serve his adherents well, allowing them to appear and disappear seemingly anywhere using their shady ‘doppelgang’.
The aim is calibrated, the muzzle is loaded and “FOOMPH!”, the deadly orb of Warpstone Gas is away!
By tinkering with basic mortar design, Clan Skryre have repurposed Death Globe ammunition to arm this Weapon Team with heinous cluster weaponry.
The projectors of their portable, Warp-powered drills gleam with energy, pulverising stone, armour and flesh!
Hand-reared, scuttling nightmares, made all the more harrowing by the fire-arrows being launched by the cackling Goblins upon their backs.
The dastardly Night Goblins gain much audacity from being mounted atop a vicious, armour-clad Squig o’ war!
To other lowlife gobbos, the Paunch is the embodiment of everything they will never be – large, idolised and in charge!
Glistening with putrid swamp gunk, Troll Hags sate their voracious appetites with anything and everything they can get their slimy hands on.
A bouncing, teeth-gnashing timebomb on legs – quite literally, the most volatile Squig one can take to battle!
Searing, molten rock spews out of its horrible pincer-jaws – being eaten whole by this Arachnarok is an entirely more favourable outcome.
Lacking the magical alterations of their war-trained equivalents, Feral Hydras are far less predictable and therefore much more dangerous!
Beware the most polluted lakes and waterways, where folk are pulled right out of their boats and down to their doom!
Nesting within the murkiest, smelliest swamps, the most foetid of River Trolls are always smelled before they are seen!
The power of the God of Brutal Cunning (or Cunning Brutality) manifest, bound in excrement and shamanic magic.
The appearance of this immense, animated totem is a sign that Gork (or Mork) himself has come to indulge in the carnage of the Waaagh!
As proven by the stone-eating, mountain-dwelling variety, a Troll’s natural resilience is boosted by a ravenous diet of rocks, pebbles, and dirt.
{{tr:wh2_dlc15_unit_short_text_grn_mon_wyvern_waaagh}}
No two Pump Wagons are ever built the same, but all crash into the foe with the same devastating, bone-breaking crunch!
With the aid of rudimentary ‘flappas’, Pump Wagons use their bouncing momentum to collide into enemy battle lines with greater bone-shattering speed.
The murderous simplicity of 'da rollas with lotsa spikes' make them a familiar sight in many a Greenskin Waaagh!
These uniquely chaotic Snotling-powered war machines are armed with ruinous spores, splattering their enemies as they careen haphazardly into the battle lines.
As proven by the battle-weathered Archmages of Ghur, even the most advanced military designs benefit from the presence of feral Sorcerers.
With a deep knowledge of mortality, endings, and the passage of time, the Archmage of death brandishes the grimmest of powers.
In the stead of he who conducts the Winds of Aqshy, the High Elves’ battle ranks are boosted by fiery, cataclysmic magic.
Unearthly and dreamlike in their demeanours, Archmages of Azyr have mastered celestial might to channel the power of the stars themselves.
Only the most adept Archmages wield True Magic, allowing them to summon pure, mystical energies from the most tumultuous eddies of the Winds.
The immense power of the earth and the seasons fuels the Lore of Life, bolstering the Elves’ inherent affinity with nature.
The powers of radiance are wielded only by Archmages of profound mental illumination and advanced magical puissance.
To an Archmage, the Lore of Metal is not just alchemy, but the key to manipulating and transmuting metals for military advantage.
The Shadowmancers of the Asur are the most dreaded of deceivers, able to orchestrate spells of confusion, illusion, and unseen death.
Self-sworn to defend Ulthuan’s shores, the dour ruler of Tor Yvresse carries out his duty by any means necessary.
Imrik’s feats in defence of Ulthuan in ages past have made him indisputably the greatest of Caledor’s Dragon Princes.
All Mages of the Asur are tuned into the wild nature of the world, embracing it to utilise magics of primal savagery.
There are few mages amongst the Asur who dispense death like the manipulators of Shyish, the darkest shade of deadly magics.
Elven Pyromancers command an impressive array of violently destructive spells, making them well placed in the Asur battle ranks.
The extreme longevity of Elves allows for the accrual of a deeper knowledge than other races of the magical metamorphosis of metals for war.
Fighting with virtue and an innate loyalty to their kin, the Talons eschew obedience in favour of righteous cause.
Once of the household of Eltharion’s late father, the Faithbearers’ guilt over their master’s death drives them to fight to reclaim their valour.
The dangers of navigating the skies over mist-covered Yvresse make these Griffon Knights some of the most talented wingmen in all Ulthuan.
Former training partners to the Warden himself in his youth, the Sentinels are amongst his most trusted servicemen.
Swift and energetic, the Skyhawks are never weary of battle, always standing ready to fight to the death if necessary.
The honour guards of the Warden’s tower are Tor Yvresse’s foremost defenders and the anchor around which its armies gather.
These aloof warriors are no mere militia, but some of the most willing fighters in Ulthuan’s defence against the foul denizens of the world.
To the Asur, the fabled airborne companions of Asuryan the Creator are both the harbingers of woe and bearers of hope.
The Emperor of the Heavens’ living symbol is a majestic firebird of legend, said to have emerged from the very Flames of Asuryan.
Driven by savage instinct and bestial strength, Chrace’s War Lions are rightly feared and respected by all High Elves of Ulthuan.
The legendary father of the White Lions and ally to Kurnous, God of the Hunt, lives on through his fearsome pride.
These lion-pulled chariots do not pick at the enemy, but charge headlong into the fray brandishing fang, claw and axe.
To be in the Warlord’s cadre, scheming must come as naturally as breathing, for it takes a great leader to speak great lies.
Monstrous mutant brawn and a warrior’s instinct make Ghoritch one of the greatest creations to ever emerge from Hell Pit.
Specially trained to deliver lashing pain, Packmasters excel at hurting their enemies while simultaneously goading their hulking monstrosities to do the same.
Frequently ferocious due to his extreme metabolism, the most ingenious Master Mutator of Hell Pit is nonetheless unparalleled in his monster-splicing abilities.
The most brutish horrors of the rat brood bite, savage, and devour anything within reach of their razor-sharp teeth.
No name can ever express the true nature of this grotesque monstrosity, or aptly describe its unsurpassed loathsomeness!
The cream of Clan Moulder’s creations, augmented with greater size and strength, and in some cases a transplanted mind!
Much like the Tinker-in-Chief who commissioned its creation, this grotesque mutant has had many a body part replaced or augmented.
Only the toughest specimens survive the lowest of Hell Pit’s Nine Circles, the freak-infested proving ground in the utter darkness below.
Swift paws and vicious claws let loose upon the battlefield are sure to lead to a violent, blood-drenched mass-mauling.
Those set upon by these monsters pray they die by the first bite, instead of dying painfully riddled with rabid saliva.
The Asrai’s mounted warriors wield their humble spears with graceful skill, piercing through enemy battle lines with unflappable confidence.
Tamed only by the righteous, the sight of a charging Great Stag is a terrifying glimpse into the raging heart of the forest.
All dread the coming of the stampeding Sylvan Knights, whose ghostly forms terrorise the forest’s fringes.

A pointy stick and a slavering wolf are all a Hobgoblin really needs to rise through the ranks – if the beast doesn’t kill him first!
The Dark Lands breed few more noisome bandits than the mounted Hobgoblins, who evade their foes much quicker than their footslogging kin!
The part-petrified form of the High Priest of Hashut betokens his status as the most ancient living Sorcerer of Zharr-Naggrund.

The largest and least pleasant of the Bull Centaurs are their Taur'ruk Lords, who combine the keen intelligence of their full-Dawi cousins, but with all the heft that four powerful legs bring to proceedings.
Part-mechanical engineer, part-black sorcerer. The very definition of heartless evil.
Part-mechanical engineer, part-black sorcerer. The very definition of heartless evil.
Part-mechanical engineer, part-black sorcerer. The very definition of heartless evil.
Part-mechanical engineer, part-black sorcerer. The very definition of heartless evil.
Brutally maintaining the Dhrath-Zharr empire’s farthest reaches with ashes and suffering, the Ashen kindles ambitions of a triumphant return to prominence within his spiteful breast.
Gorduz is a survivor; a thoroughly dangerous individual whose talent for survival is matched only by his inborn aggression in battle.
The captains of the Infernal Guard are marked out by their despicable cruelty and taste for bloody violence whenever the opportunity presents itself.
Someone has to keep the ingrate Labourers in line. Sometimes, this involves killing a few to make a point…
The greatest of the Chaos Dwarf Daemonsmiths are the priests of Hashut, as well as master artificers.
The greatest of the Chaos Dwarf Daemonsmiths are the priests of Hashut, as well as master artificers.
The greatest of the Chaos Dwarf Daemonsmiths are the priests of Hashut, as well as master artificers.
The greatest of the Chaos Dwarf Daemonsmiths are the priests of Hashut, as well as master artificers.
Zhatan’s cruelty knows no bounds, for he is the most pitiless warrior ever to have trodden upon the blackened earth of Zharr.
Press the trigger just once and a veritable hail of spikey iron death is fired directly at the target. Truly the most destructive hand weapon in the world.
When their massed blunderbusses are presented, a headlong charge towards the elite Granite Guard is doomed to failure (and to be full of holes!).
The Chaos Dwarf Warrior's mastery of arms is matched only by his innate cruelty and desire to crush utterly any who dare stand in the way of his infernal objectives.
Grim, cruel and arrogant, Chaos Dwarf Warriors regard their foes with utter contempt and their masters with utter loyalty.
Blazing beards are exactly what occurs if just one of these specialist warriors was to drop his naphtha bomb, rather than hurl it at the foe!
They're only there because you made them do it and would run or kill you in an instant, so it's important to direct Labourers' aggression squarely at the foe and keep it that way.
Bows are the perfect weapon for the naturally cowardly Hobgoblins, for they get to kill from a safe distance and retreat in the screaming face of danger.
The vilest and most treacherous of all their horrible kin, Hobgoblin Cutthroats delight in the unleashing of unnecessarily-vicious violence in battle.
The sneakiest of the sneaky, you might say. The finest assassins and ambushers of the Chaos Dwarf military.
Come the fray, either dishonour's dark stain shall be removed or the bearer himself must die…
A compact, heavily-constructed repeating handgun, the Fireglaive also incorporates a single-edged chopping blade, with which the Infernal Guard cut a literal swathe through the foe.
The most rigorously drilled warriors among their kind, no armament is too great for the Infernal Guard to handle.
The greatest among their Infernal Guard peers, the Ironsworn form a protective cordon around their commander and keep the enemy hordes at bay.
This legendary Ironsworn unit are so named due to their remarkable hardiness, even for Dwarfs, and talent for staying alive, as well as their terrifying countenances!
They're stupid, lumbering gits, but strong and aggressive, so therefore useful to the Chaos Dwarfs, both in the mines and on the battlefield.
Wreathed in smoke, these huge, winged Daemonic-bulls are blessed with flesh that burns with the intensity of a living furnace that sparks the ground 'neath their hooves.
As creatures of flame and ash, the Red Bulls of Hashut cannot stray far from the Dark Lands save for when the Winds of Magic – and Aqshy specifically – are at their strongest.
K'daai Destroyers are massive versions of their Daemonic Fireborn brethren, often fashioned into the likeness of Hashut himself. Point them at the enemy and watch the carnage unfold…
The "Scions of Fire" are mighty Daemonic fire-elementals trapped by sorcery and science within the Chaos Dwarfs' hulking, armoured creations.
Believed to be a rare mutation of the Great Taurus, the magical Lammasu are the living embodiment of the Dark Lands' rage, exhaling sorcerous clouds to protect their riders.
Handle this devastating projectile weapon with extreme care, for the fire-spirits it unleashes are undiscerning, and will devour the Dawi-Zharr just as easily as their unfortunate foes.
What it lacks in speed, the Dreadquake Mortar gains in power, for it can take down walls and large, static enemies, blasting them to matchwood.
The Chaos Dwarf's mastery of steam technology is clear to all when this colossal Daemonic war machine takes to the field.

This modified version of the Iron Daemon bears twin flame throwers instead of firing shrapnel into the foe's massed ranks. In case you're wondering which is worse, sharp metal fragments or blazing fire, believe me – it's fire!
One blast from this aptly-named field gun and the foe is instantly turned to fire; two, and they are reduced to a pile of greasy ash.
This Iron Daemon carries the Skullcracker attachment with it – a constantly moving amalgam of blades and points fiendishly designed to mash the enemy to a bloody pulp.
Though Ulrika has taken the Blood Kiss, it does not define her. She remains loyal to humanity, to death and far beyond.
Many of us wish their lives were different, but be careful what you wish for, because Change will NOT be what you expected…
Come, join us in our dance. Come join us on the road. Let us lay a carpet of trickery and madness in the Changer's blessed name!
Brutal even for a butcher, armed to the teeth, utterly singular in purpose, and with three heads. Your chances? Next to zero.
Stalwarts of Cathayan military excellence, who hold themselves to a higher standard than any lesser warrior can fathom.
The enemy are not getting in, not without a wealth of the bloodiest violence and wave upon wave of screaming, agonising death.
Administrator of the realm, architect of the Dragon Emperor’s will, and executioner of his enemies.
Intrigue and subtlety must sometimes be abandoned in favour of talon and fang.
With mighty wings outstretched and composite bow at the ready, Saytang's arrows cannot be turned aside.
Bolts of blue fire blessed by the Moon Dragon's destructive power deliver her scorn from afar.
Silhouetted in macabre shapes, abominable airborne monsters gaze down from the sky, seeing all.
The Empress' eyes and ears take many forms, none more dreaded than her personal murder of Crowmen.
A terrifying example of the breed, these lions each sport a pair of giant wings, enabling them to bear down their savage attacks from above as well as at ground level.
This giant avian is blessed by the Moon Empress and enveloped in silvery flame that will burn the foe to ash at the slightest touch.
In living jade lies raw spell-power bound to stone – a bestial conduit of sorcery!
An arcane aura of sorcery-diminishing energy surrounds the blackness of the Jet Guardian’s monstrous frame.
Counting bodies like sheep to the rhythm of the War Drums…
Do you hear that? That's the sound of our death approaching!
They may look like middle-aged, reactionary landowners, but the Druzhina fight with considerable skill when their way of life is under threat.
Naryska Leysa is the finest warrior Kislev has to offer, consecrated by the Cult of Ursun and favoured by the Ice Court: the living Wrath of Kislev.
The Koldunja tend the spirits of the land, calling upon them for their placation, summoning or banishment.
The Znarkharja have deep knowledge of all ailments and can tap into life-forces to heal or debilitate.
The power of ‘the sight’ gifts attunement with the frightening power of nature, spirits and lifeforces combined into malicious spellcraft.
The Vorozheja communicate with spirits of ill-fortune to twist reality and manipulate the future.
Behold the horrors endured by the hag's foes at the end of her cauldron's smoky tendrils; Mother Ostankya is a dreaded sight to all!
There's nothing to see but a tranquil treeline… and projectiles flying from it with pinpoint precision.
No man could fail to tremble in fear once the wolves of winter descend.
Nothing irks these fighting men of Kislev more than the forces of Chaos, but "people from the south" come a close second…
What the blunderbuss doesn't finish, the axe certainly will!
These giant beasts lurk beneath the frozen tundra, waiting to rise up and freeze the foe to icy death.
Such a creature is driven by monstrous hunger, endlessly prowling for fresh meat.
Be wary men, death could be lurking in those trees…
They say a single bite is enough to put this feral beast's prey beyond the help of healing.
New life springs forth at every touch – a debt only the death of his enemies can pay for.
Wherever the Wandering Wizards go, magic and carnage are sure to follow.
Depthless Daemonic malice and a low tolerance for boredom incite the Changeling’s ever-shifting schemes... and appearance.
Hahaha! You think this is the real Changeling? IT IS.
Treachery, misery, violence, insanity… You'll experience all that while being torn apart by a rabid beast at the same time…
Few beings are equally as dangerous in death as they are in life.
Even such an evolved creature is still a rampaging monster at heart.
Even the mightiest of creatures must fear the Cockatrice, for its gaze means certain death...
Abomination! What manner of twisted creature is that?
How exactly does one fight a twisted mass of tentacles and teeth?
…and now the heavens send their love: your sudden death from above!
Get the right elevation, pull the lever, and their skin comes off just like that!
Why throw a single axe when you can throw several all at once?
Surviving this long against such terrible odds is either due to luck or martial skill, honed to a razor’s edge – probably both.
Loners by nature, resenting any distraction, and committed only to dying gloriously!
There's a lot of things to mourn in war – your death won't be one of them!
Once shame has stained the soul, it can only be wiped away with blood.

Fitting Trollhammer torpedoes to a Gyrocopter is audacious engineering, but the safest way to take out larger monsters from afar.
{{tr:unit_description_short_texts_text_wh_main_unit_short_text_dwf_hammerers}}
Fear? Never heard of it.
The least successful of all Slayers; these warriors have thrown themselves into deadly combat countless times and somehow survived.
A lust for treasure, obsession with danger, and affinity for rum has Slayer Pirates venture where few sailors willingly go.
Fifteen Dwarfs and a dead Dwarf’s chest,\\nYo, ho, ho and a flagon of ale,\\nEach one a goner means more for the rest!
{{tr:unit_description_short_texts_text_wh_main_unit_short_text_dwf_slayers}}
Whether riddling a single foe or blasting a swathe into oncoming troops, the dual barrels of the Grudge-raker make easy work of it!
What use is a gun in the close quarters of a mine shaft? Depends on the gun. Depends on the Dwarf!

It may look rather 'lightweight' but the cannons sure pack a punch.
Condensed within every rocket is a volatile mote engrained with the strength of Elspeth's magic, ready to unleash vortices of swirling death.
A reminder of man’s mortality lies in the dread nature of these Knights’ frightening appearance, ostensibly at odds with their motto: “Fear Not Death”.
On the Magisterix's command, these riders unleash dark, withering shots that drain the lifeforce of any who are successfully hit.
They say the Graveyard Rose walks the hazy barrier between the realm of the living and the realm of the dead.
War is but the beginning of true innovation.
Give a great Engineer a workshop, he’ll win you the battle. Give him command of an army, and he could win you the war.
When judgement comes calling, woe betide anyone sentenced to face the headsman's swing.
The power of alchemy manifested in battlefield sorcery; the Gold Wizard is worth his weight in the purest gold.
Heavy armour shields these Ironsides from Elspeth’s ensorcelled munitions, so they can fire their weapons without their own flesh degrading!
This company of sharpshooters uses specially-modified rifles and unerring accuracy to fell their foes from several hundred paces.
Merchants beset whilst travelling the trade road from Hergig have seen their approaching foe drop dead with a loud crack, and no gunmen to be seen.
When gifted with the finest training money can buy, every bullet finds its mark.
Charged with defending mortar and cannon batteries in combat, these stalwart warriors never allow an artillery position to become overwhelmed.
The Dark Lady's imbuements make for a most terrifying Land Ship, that brings forth a hail of death-carrying spells and firepower.
As expensive vanity projects go, few are quite so large, or quite as deadly…
Created by the forges of Nuln for the Guild masters of Marienburg, this prototype has had no expense spared on its finery or munitions.
Combined with rolling, steel-clad machinery, a manoeuvrable and superbly armoured Volley Gun is a truly deadly piece of equipment.
These grotesque flying monstrosities spread the word of decay via deadly clusters of diseased shrapnel, inflicting the most horrid of maladies.
What little survives the slobbering jaws, will meet their doom by a lance of utterly foul afflictions.
Once-esteemed Knights fallen to a more putrid embrace – what remains of their former banner are tactics disgustingly twisted for their new lords.
When the beastly hordes roar, hungry for battle, dark sorcery shall aid in their slaughter!
The Plaguelord’s hosts are led with the exuberance of a carnival, their leaders ostentatiously marked with the grisly palette of sickness.
Nurgle wields the ways of death; through His conjurers, leeching the souls of His foes.
The Plague Lord's watchmen oversee His beloved children, spreading malaise and invigorating the sickly masses.
So many diseases to catalogue, and so little time!
There is no end to the vile horrors that madness could drive one so foul to enact.
Wielding such dark and ancient arcane power, Ketzak will not remain forgotten for long.
The most vicious cruelties are often inspired by the darkest of ambitions.
To be considered 'befouled' by even the virulent hordes of Nurgle is a disgustingly impressive feat indeed.
Revenge is best served at the tip of a bloodied claw, and the point of sharp and gnashing teeth.
Nothing can survive the onslaught of one prophesied to be desolation incarnate.
The Beastmen’s living tribute to the Lord of Pestilence swarm and breed prodigiously, wallowing in war and filth.
All fear the booming steps of an Ogre, twisted and mutated by the malignant forces of Chaos.
Size is no defence against an oncoming plague, nor against the great weapons of Nurgle’s beloved adoptees.
When steel becomes corroded and arrows turn to ash, there is little wonder as to why no one survives this esteemed guardian of Nurgle's garden.
Slimy as a toad; deadly as a Dragon.
Take heed, little ones. You stand in the presence of a champion of proliferation.
KILL!
The belligerent Rhinox's near-blindness is no obstacle to the mindless destruction its Ogre rider demands.
The only sure way to escape the pulverising charge of a half-blind Rhinox is to make oneself smell like another Rhinox.
An Ogre rider can control his slavering Mournfang only by raining repeated blows upon its iron-hard skull.
Spike-armoured Ogre and thunderous, indefatigable mountain beast: the heaviest shock cavalry in the known world.
To be flattened by the Mournfang's unstoppable charge is a more merciful death than being consumed by its ravenous rider.
Vicious enough to be useful but dim enough to be obedient, Gnoblars are commonly used as slaves, cannon fodder, ammunition or appetisers.
Larger and smarter than the average Gnoblar, which isn't saying much, but their snares provide a steady stream of meat.
The only thing more frightening than a charging Ogre is an even bigger charging Ogre.
Roasting and tenderising enemies with point-blank cannon fire creates delicious, ready-to-eat meals.
Nomadic mercenaries, adorned in the garish trappings of the kingdoms they have visited, fought for and terrorised.
Many have lost a limb (or several) as a consequence of laughing at the sight of a hulking Ogre wearing a feathered hat and breeches.
Unusually astute Ogre mercenaries, boasting the exotic spoils and countless scars of far-off wars.
The lurid trophies of their many distant conflicts ensure that no two of these wandering mercenaries are armed the same way.
Sheer brute strength, unending hunger, and barely enough wit to know fear. Nothing matters more to an Ogre Bull than his next meal.
No Ogre truly needs weapons to pulverise his foes, for his immense fists suffice. But all Ogres crave trophies…
Their spiked metal gauntlets can shred foes to ribbons – which means less chewing later.
Even the dullest Ogre appears a genius against these gargantuan, vagrant cretins.
Outcast Ogre whelps become ravenous, sinewy, cannibalistic horrors, bereft of all reason.
Hunting beasts made entirely of coiled muscle and bereft of all fear.
Hide as hard as rock, horns that can tear mountain-tops asunder, hooves that can flatten legions.
Only the steeliest of Ogre trappers can face down a Stonehorn's rock-shattering charge and live to tell the tale.
Though it seems a miracle that this ramshackle catapult functions, its devastating firepower is not to be doubted.
A vast sky-cannon crudely lashed to beast-driven wheels, its thunderous volleys able to decimate entire regiments.
The swiftly-propagating flames of Fire Rain Rockets more than make up for their undependable accuracy.
Wrought in the sacred form of fire-belching Dragon-mouths, their flaming cannonballs can topple almost any foe.
Their thunderous charges are as fearsome within cramped city streets as they are upon the plains of war.
The riders of the Celestial Host are the elite of the elite. The Dragon Emperor trusts only his own kin more than they.
Stoic Cathayan cavalry, as expendable as they are dutiful. The Celestial Emperor thanks them for their sacrifice.
Once outcasts for dabbling in forbidden elements, now prized for their fearsome mastery of metal and fire.
Favoured Wizard of the Emperor himself, granted knowledge of Celestial sorcery perfected across millennia.
Celestial blood grants both unassailable authority and rare mastery of the Elemental Winds.
Powerful Sorcerers second only to the Dragons themselves, Shugengan can bend the eight winds to their whims.
Though the Iron Dragon possesses untold authority, decades of Warpstone experimentation have taken a toll upon his mind.
Incomparable elemental wisdom paired with the raw Celestial power of a Dragon.
A master strategist requires unquestioning allegiance from the vast armies of their great city.
Favoured child of the Celestial Emperor, revered defender of the Great Bastion and imperious majesty incarnate.
There comes a time when only a true Dragon can defend Grand Cathay.
At the Moon Empress' behest, warriors return from the underworld to defend Grand Cathay; a brief glimmer of light before they must return to the darkness.
Only the hardiest of souls can survive the elegant volleys of Nan-Gau's devastatingly precise artillery.
The Dragon Emperor's personal bodyguard, the greatest of mortal warriors, and a shining inspiration to all Cathay.
Only the Celestial Host enjoy the greatest armaments of the Dragon Empire, for only they can guarantee victory upon the field of battle.
Should Cathay's enemies dare approach, Iron Hail volleys can shred steel plate as if it were rice-paper.
Though Cathayan crossbows are infallible, they are nothing without the discipline of the Jade soldiers who wield them.
Should the Dragon Emperor's foes survive the hail that greets their approach, they will be dashed against a near-impregnable wall of shields.
Finding harmony in stone and steel, their minds are as ordered as their finely-armoured ranks.
The living embodiment of Cathay's nigh-impregnable Great Bastion, for few enemies can hope to breach their armoured line.
Though they are but humble villagers, the Moon Dragon herself guides their aim.
Though common folk lack the training of the Jade Warriors, they fight in vast numbers and with absolute devotion to their Dragon.
Warriors of wind and field, united in harmony, their bristling spears keeping the Dragon Emperor's foes at bay.
The fearless stone giants stand guard across the length and breadth of the Celestial Empire, awaiting the Dragon Emperor's call.
The very heavens catch fire in their wake…
A flame-borne air-ship as immense as any sea-faring craft, capable of laying waste to entire legions.
A floating symbol of Cathay's pre-eminence, powered by the burning wings of magical Warbirds.
This mighty war Compass can harness the elements themselves, for even wind and lightning serve the Dragon Emperor's will.
Regardless of the wishes of his former masters, the Bearer will ascend to Godhood, and reign over the shadows forever.
Daemon Princes are amongst the greatest and most powerful servants of Chaos.
Enslaved by the Dawi-Zharr in his mortal life, he formed a pact with the Chaos Gods and was freed by a flock of Daemonic Furies.
After killing all who faced Ulgor in the pit he was a due a large reward of gold and 'freedom' from his owner. Instead, he slaughtered his keeper and joined Khorne’s legions.
It was Grand Vomitus who brought the infamous Canker Blight to the citizens of Artois and delivered the Vrux Beard Lice to Karak Azul. What other gifts shall he bring to mortalkind?
This Daemon Prince has been stealing into the Mortal World through a mirror. Once through, they will take the mirror as a shield and quickly muster their darkling host.
A promising Wizard in his past life, he was seduced by Chi'an Chi. Rumours spread that the Feathered-Prince can now control the flow of time itself.
The purest form of Ruinous energy, these Furies serve no one Chaos God in particular; their aspect changes with the balance of power as the Great Game rages.
Bloodletters borne upon colossal Juggernauts, living engines of carnage – shock cavalry as unstoppable as they are terrifying.
Knights in hell-forged armour, rewarded for their savage duty with Daemonic mounts from which to spill ever-deeper rivers of blood.
This champion is hardened by the scars of countless battles and granted will enough to command a modicum of Khorne's Blood Legion.
A terrifying fusion of unbridled rage and sheer mass. No skull shall be safe.
A smoke-belching, flesh-mangling, skull-consuming engine of purest destruction.
Cultists of the Blood God are brutes in battle, hoping to draw their master's gaze.
A mortal warrior with strength and bloodlust beyond any other, charging atop a berserker steed fed on human flesh.
Most powerful and most brutal of all Daemon warriors, living only to spill blood and harvest skulls in Khorne's name.
Driven to madness by its unending lust for slaughter, this legend insanely spurs the Blood Legion on to ever-greater acts of destruction.
A veteran consumed by its desire for unchecked slaughter. Murderous madness paired with unstoppable force.
A mighty Daemon engine, the physical manifestation of Khorne's favour, fuelled by the molten skulls of its countless victims.
Mindless fury, boundless ferocity – an engine of destruction, forever seeking redemption for an act of betrayal against the Blood God.
The Lesser Daemon of Khorne is a behorned, blood-hungry footsoldier.
Those Bloodletters that bring their master more skulls are elevated, and so their lust for blood grows.
These foul, winged Daemons are murderous Khornate energy made flesh.
Apex predators warped by the Ruinous energies of Chaos, forever desirous to gorge upon mortal flesh.
Fighters raised from the strongest of Northmen stock, but no longer truly human.
Living weapons in the service of Khorne, far stronger than scores of mortal men. No sane horseman would ride toward their hell-forged halberds.
When you fight for blood, and for Khorne, others’ simple necessities, such as sleep and food, are entirely meaningless.
Primal blood-hunters bereft of all fear, capable of tracking any prey for an eternity.
The Doom Hound, Simaergul, a favoured pet of the Blood God sent to defend the Brazen Altar.
The greatest of Khorne's Daemons, a Bloodthirster thinks only of the hunt and the skulls to be gathered in the Blood God's name.
A bull-headed Beastman pledged to the service of Khorne, for no other could provide the hot blood and red meat the Minotaur craves.
Gore-crazed, man-eating Minotaurs equipped with ancient weapons of legend harvested from their countless victims' shattered corpses.
A fallen Daemon given new life, of a sort, within a colossal, soul-harvesting hulk.
Those unable to bear the force and fury of Khorne's gifts become Spawn, with all former reason replaced by wrathful madness.
A blood-soaked, rolling altar to the Murder God's glory, bristling with fell blades, jagged spikes and the shattered skulls of the fallen.
This Daemon-infused machine bombards any who escape its wheels with their comrades’ burning, screeching skulls.
Though any wealthy soul can hire these elite horsemen, all the coin in the Motherland could not make them turn upon their queen.
The roving vanguard of Kislev's armies are sworn to protect the Motherland's desolate borders from all who threaten her.
On the freezing oblasts of Kislev, man and mount must live, die – and kill – as one.
There is no more sacred an animal to the Motherland than the mighty bear. Its savage fury must be respected before it can be harnessed.
There is no more sacred an animal to the Motherland than the mighty bear. Its savage fury must be respected before it can be harnessed.
Many is the regiment who has broken and run rather than be crushed beneath the thunderous hooves of Kislev's legendary cavalry.
The Tzar of Tzars, the true believer, reborn to light in Kislev's darkest hour.
Though all Kislevites are equal in the eyes of the Motherland's gods, a Boyar is born to rule. His authority is absolute.
Any who mistake her youth for weakness will soon find themselves in a frozen grave.
Trained in the secrets of Ice Court since she was a girl, now wielding power most could only dream of.
Though her graceful bearing belies her deadly sorcery, the power of Winter itself flows through her veins.
By definition, the Ice Witch has delved into the most tempestuous of magical lores.
Tzarina Katarin is the greatest Ice Witch for generations, capable of arcane feats not seen since the Khan-Queens of old.
To disobey the Supreme Patriarch is to disobey Ursun himself. All deemed guilty of such heresy will pay an agonising price.
Believe in the Great Orthodoxy! Believe in the Motherland! Faith is all the armour any man needs!
The Motherland's finest warriors fight tirelessly, knowing that a well-earned drink or twelve awaits all who survive the battle.
Kislev's military elite, bearing their heavy armour and heavier weapons without complaint. Tomorrow brings rest, but today they fight.
Few have faced the magically-augmented warrior women of the Ice Court and lived to tell the tale.
Wielding magic and might in equal measure, the Ice Guard execute the unyielding will of the Tzarina herself.
Workers and warriors of forest and field, their proud hearts armouring them against elements and enemies alike.
A Kossar always warrants respect, for the working man represents the true spirit of the Motherland.
For distant cowards, the barrel of the gun. For nearby fools, the blade of the axe.
For the sake of all Kislev, the Tzarina permits her personal bodyguards to fight alongside the common man.
Those Kossars who fight hardest and longest for the Motherland's freedom are granted the honour of serving the Tzars themselves.
Just as Kislev's people fight to safeguard their land, so too will the land fight for its people.
Should the Tzarina will it, even the ravenous beasts of the oblast will fight to protect the Motherland.
Large sleds drawn by the fiercest of War Bears pack a crushing punch when pulled at speed into ordered enemy battlelines.
Even the cruellest elements are no obstacle to the Motherland's sturdy War Sleds.
Countless slaves of Chaos have fallen to this ancient cannon's roaring fusillades. To fight alongside it stokes pride in any Kislevite heart.
Great, galavanting bears of the wild, with strength and temperament enough to match foes thrice their size.
Larger than the brown bears of the south, these hulking beasts carry an aura of chill about them even when far from the ice.
Plaguebearers conveyed into battle atop shrieking, repugnant Rot Flies, winged Daemon-beasts whose speed is matched only by their indescribable hideousness.
The winged cavalry of Nurgle's rot legion, their grotesque Rot Fly mounts spitting the plague-drenched skulls of previous victims at their foes below.
Brackish Plague Toads pressed into service and forced to bear necrotic Plaguebearers into battle.
Each of this pox-ridden devotee's horrifying afflictions is a gift from their loving Plaguefather.
A towering, grotesque facsimile of the Plague God himself, his myriad sores oozing unspeakable disease.
To those able to withstand Nurgle's Rot the longest, the Plague Lord grants wit and reason far beyond that of their decaying, droning subordinates.
The Foetid Brewmaster tests his countless, horrific contagions by launching fusillades of infected Nurglings into the enemy's midst.
They stand above the droning mass of Plaguebearers, blessed by Father Nurgle with pestilent sorcery and a modicum of individual thought.
Winged Daemons, murderous Nurgle energy made flesh, that prey upon the weak from the margins of battle.
A man granted one too many of Nurgle's pestilent gifts, with flesh warped and mind broken as the Plague God's blessings overwhelm him.
Tiny, squealing Daemons, each little more than an ambulatory pus spore, they spread lethal disease throughout scores of foes.
A droning mass of Daemon footsoldiers, their broken, oozing flesh painted with the scars and sores of the Plague Lord's inexorable rot.
This shambling, droning, nauseating mass is tasked by the Fly Lord to dispense disease, decay and the gift of death to all.
Any other lifeform is a potential friend to this ooze-drenched, pox-slobbering beast – until they inevitably die, of course.
The greatest of the Fly Lord's decaying legion, a shuddering behemoth of filth and disease, spreading ruin with boundless delight.
A putrid Daemon pus-beast caked in filth, considered lower even than Nurglings, and whose gaping, noxious maw can consume a man in a heartbeat.

Those who enter Athel Loren without permission must answer for such a transgression.
Galloping to war with Orion, his personal guard bring a calamity to all who stand against them.
Agile and deadly in melee - an excellent first-response to impending threats.
The path to Ruinous glory is strewn with the butchered remains of those who fell by the wayside.
Horse-born leaders, their powerful steeds a symbol of dread status before the Dark Gods.

More rudimentary than other Dwarf artillery, but nevertheless ruthlessly proficient at destroying their foes.

Centuries of shame in defeat shall be washed away ‘neath my hammer; Clan Angrund will rise again!

Keen and sharp, these Dwarfs know every nook, every cranny of the mountains.

The biggest, nastiest, most bad-tempered of Big 'Uns, this elite mob will stomp ya and jump about on da bitz afterwards.

Riding a Squig is a dangerous, foolish business. Goblins, however, are better riders than most, so live slightly longer.

It takes a certain kind of insanity to ride a rage-frothed Squig and bounce into the fray.
Although not as mighty as Orcs, Night Goblins nevertheless control their forces through fear and savage, macabre bloodlust.
Pernicious and sly, Skarsnik retains command through deception, subterfuge and no small amount of murder.

After riding their enemies down, what grim prize these Goblins claim is their own dark, devilish business.
Poisonous, corrosive venom dripping from her fearsome jaws, she first ensnares her victims in a web of dense, sticky silk.
Wurrzag is beholden to no tribe nor lord, only the whisperings of the Greenskin gods in his addled mind.
A hippogryph is no easy prize, but its power in battle makes the effort to tame one worth it.
The rarest of all steeds, only the most noble of Bretonnians ride these dignified, sophisticated creatures into battle.
As stern and determined as the endless ocean, and as savage as the rolling tempest.
Although a fierce foe to Bretonnia's enemies, Knights should be wary of their kleptomaniac tendencies…
The trebuchet - far superior to the catapult - hurls thrice-blessed stones at the enemy, crushing them with devout fury.
To control animals and twist their natural aggression to your own ends shows true mastery of your art.
Proponents of the Lore of Life protect and heal friendly troops and allies, whilst forestalling their foes at every turn.
The power that she wields, both on and off the battlefield, shapes the course of nations.
Every Squire dreams of becoming a Knight, and every Knight dreams of having a better Squire…
The holy relics of the Lady, the most sacred in all Bretonnia, are guarded by the most fervent and fearsome of warriors.

The holder of secrets and keeper of the way, whose strength is the quester's ultimate test.
The most junior of Knights, they fight determinedly to make a name for themselves.
The flame of the Lady goes with this arrow, and so too the low-born archer before long…
Let poisoned arrows fly, and by blessed grace find their mark, though the bowmen may never know why.

Not just to command nature, but to range animals' primal rage against your foe? That is true power.

These spellcasters use the Lore of Life to protect friendly troops, yet frustrate and confound enemies.

Feeding on a banquet of flesh tossed into their dire-furnaces, these Hellcannons fire bolts of devastating energy towards distant enemies.

A most evil Sorcerer, known for tormenting his foes by ensuring that death only comes to them after great suffering.

Once an awe-inspiring parade of powerful beasts, now reduced to the last few dangerous descendants of the legendary herd.

The half-feral, gore-obsessed Skin Wolves, armoured so their slaughter may continue unabated.

This twisted and enraged beast is a terrifying totem of might and power.

A terrifying beast of myth and legend, emanating shrieks of the damned from the Ruinous Realm itself.
